infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
        • infodynamics.measures.discrete.SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator
          • infodynamics.measures.discrete.EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SingleAgentMeasureDiscrete

    public class EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete
extends SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator

    Entropy rate calculator for univariate discrete (int[]) data (ie computes entropy over blocks of consecutive states in time). Implements entropy rate as entropy of next state conditional on the embedded past (as per the alternative definition used by Crutchfield and Feldman, see below) rather than the limiting rate of block entropy over block size.

    Usage of the class is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator: EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete(int, int);
    2. Initialise the calculator using ContextOfPastMeasureCalculatorDiscrete.initialise();
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to sets of addObservations(int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average entropy: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • local entropy values, such as SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator.computeLocal(int[]);
      • and variants of these.
    5. As an alternative to steps 3 and 4, the user may undertake standalone computation from a single set of observations, via e.g.: SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator.computeLocal(int[]), SingleAgentMeasureDiscreteInContextOfPastCalculator.computeAverageLocal(int[]) etc.
    6. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    References:

    • T. M. Cover and J. A. Thomas, 'Elements of Information Theory' (John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1991).
    • J. P. Crutchfield, D. P. Feldman, "Regularities Unseen, Randomness Observed: Levels of Entropy Convergence", Chaos, Vol. 13, No. 1. (2003), pp. 25-54.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

      • EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete

        public EntropyRateCalculatorDiscrete(int base,
                             int history)
        Construct a new instance
        Parameters:
        base - number of symbols for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedded history length of the destination to condition on - this is k in Schreiber's notation.
